From Yara's bid for the Iron Islands to Sansa breaking free of Ramsay and Littlefinger, and Daenerys finally sailing for Westeros, the women of "Game of Thrones" have made incredible strides.
But the darkest example of this is Cersei Lannister, who, in a single strike, killed all her enemies and ascended to the Iron Throne in the season finale's closing moments.
HBO A major unifying theme of the stellar sixth season of "Game of Thrones" has been women acquiring power.
Read on for a closer look at the very first Queen of the Seven Kingdoms and her terrifying rise to power:
What led her to such an act?
